title: New shasums.txt file is not accessible to download and does not handle multiple version

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

body:
A new shasums file was created (`shasums.txt`) that uses the format `shasum` and `sha256sum` can validate. But, there are two problems with it:

1. It is not available for download to verify against.
2. Does not handle multiple releases. The file is named `shasums.txt` for 3.1.0. When 3.1.1 comes out the file name for that one is also `shasums.txt`.

There there is the usability issue. If someone does have the `shasums.txt` file and tries to use it after downloading a single file they get something like...

```
$ shasum -a 256 -c shasums.txt
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-darwin-amd64.tar.gz: OK
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-386.tar.gz:
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-386.tar.gz: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm.tar.gz: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm.tar.gz: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm64.tar.gz: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm64.tar.gz: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-ppc64le.tar.gz: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-ppc64le.tar.gz: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-s390x.tar.gz: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-s390x.tar.gz: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-windows-amd64.tar.gz: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-windows-amd64.tar.gz: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-darwin-amd64.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-darwin-amd64.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-386.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-386.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-amd64.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-amd64.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm64.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-arm64.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-ppc64le.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-ppc64le.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-s390x.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-linux-s390x.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: helm-3.1.0-rc.1-windows-amd64.zip: No such file or directory
helm-3.1.0-rc.1-windows-amd64.zip: FAILED open or read
shasum: WARNING: 15 listed files could not be read

$ echo $?
1
```

Because of all the missing files the exit code IS NOT 0.

We should fix this prior to releasing 3.1.0.

I would suggest a 2 step process:

1. We break the `shasums.txt` file into one file for each download. Name them after the file + `.sha256sum` extension. When downloading a file they only need to download the corresponding checksum file and can use it with `shasum` out of the box. Being named after the file it will contain the version. This solves for 2 of the 3 problems.
2. Upload the file to get.helm.sh. The fetch-dist and signing work should also handle this new file. This will solve the other problem.

How does this plan sound?
